examples.sentence: Present Tense Usage - Base for future

sections.heading: Future in Japanese
sections.content:
Japanese doesn't have a separate future tense. Future actions are expressed using:

Present tense with time words Special expressions for intention/plans Context to indicate future meaning

明日行く "I will go tomorrow" (present form + time word) 行くつもりだ "I intend to go" (intention expression)

children.heading: With Time Words
children.content:
The most common way to express future is present tense + future time word:

明日映画を見る "I will watch a movie tomorrow" 来週東京に行きます "I will go to Tokyo next week" 今晩友達に会う "I will meet a friend tonight" 来年日本に来る "I will come to Japan next year"

children.heading: Scheduled Events
children.content: 授業は9時に始まる "Class will start at 9 o'clock" 電車は3時に出発します "The train will depart at 3 o'clock" 会議は来週の月曜日です "The meeting is next Monday"

children.heading: 〜つもりだ/です
children.content:
Expresses personal intention or plan:

Verb (dictionary form) + つもりだ/です 日本に行くつもりです "I intend to go to Japan" 大学で勉強するつもりだ "I plan to study at university" 明日早く起きるつもりです "I intend to wake up early tomorrow"

children.heading: Negative Intention
children.content: 行かないつもりだ "I don't intend to go" 食べないつもりです "I don't plan to eat" 何もしないつもりだ "I don't intend to do anything"

children.heading: 〜予定だ/です
children.content:
For scheduled plans or arrangements:

明日東京に行く予定です "I'm scheduled to go to Tokyo tomorrow" 来週会議がある予定だ "There's scheduled to be a meeting next week" 6時に着く予定です "I'm scheduled to arrive at 6 o'clock"

children.heading: Asking About Plans
children.content: 何をする予定ですか？ "What are you planning to do?" いつ来る予定ですか？ "When are you scheduled to come?"

children.heading: Expressing Probability
children.content:
Indicates something will probably happen:

Polite: 〜でしょう Plain: 〜だろう 明日は雨でしょう "It will probably rain tomorrow" 彼は来るだろう "He will probably come" 大丈夫でしょう "It will probably be okay"

children.heading: Question Form
children.content: 明日は晴れるでしょうか？ "Will it probably be sunny tomorrow?" 間に合うでしょうか？ "Will we probably make it in time?"

children.heading: 〜よう/〜ましょう
children.content:
Expresses suggestion or determination:

行こう "Let's go / I'll go" 食べましょう "Let's eat" 頑張ろう "Let's do our best / I'll do my best"

children.heading: Thinking/Deciding to Do
children.content: 行こうと思う "I'm thinking of going" 勉強しようと思います "I'm thinking of studying"

children.heading: 〜はずだ/です
children.content:
Something is expected to happen based on logic:

彼は来るはずだ "He should come / is expected to come" 間に合うはずです "We should make it in time" 明日は晴れるはずだ "It should be sunny tomorrow"

children.heading: Tomorrow and Near Future
children.content: 明日 - tomorrow 明後日 - day after tomorrow 今晩 - tonight 今夜 - tonight 後で - later すぐ - soon もうすぐ - soon

children.heading: Next Week/Month/Year
children.content: 来週 - next week 来月 - next month 来年 - next year 再来週 - week after next 再来月 - month after next 再来年 - year after next

children.heading: Present Tense (Neutral)
children.content: 明日行く "I will go tomorrow" (Simple statement of future action)

children.heading: つもり (Personal Intention)
children.content: 明日行くつもりだ "I intend to go tomorrow" (Personal plan/intention)

children.heading: 予定 (Scheduled Plan)
children.content: 明日行く予定だ "I'm scheduled to go tomorrow" (Arranged/scheduled)

children.heading: でしょう (Probability)
children.content: 明日行くでしょう "I will probably go tomorrow" (Likely to happen)

children.heading: はず (Expected)
children.content: 明日行くはずだ "I should go tomorrow" (Expected based on circumstances)

children.heading: Example 1: Weekend Plans
children.content: A: 週末は何をする予定ですか？ "What are you planning to do this weekend?" B: 映画を見に行くつもりです "I intend to go see a movie" A: 何を見ますか？ "What will you watch?" B: 新しいアクション映画を見ます "I'll watch the new action movie"

children.heading: Example 2: Tomorrow's Weather
children.content: A: 明日の天気はどうでしょうか？ "What will tomorrow's weather be like?" B: たぶん雨でしょう "It will probably rain" A: じゃあ、傘を持って行きましょう "Then let's bring umbrellas"

children.heading: Example 3: Future Plans
children.content: A: 将来何をするつもりですか？ "What do you intend to do in the future?" B: 日本で働くつもりです "I intend to work in Japan" A: いつ日本に行く予定ですか？ "When are you scheduled to go to Japan?" B: 来年行く予定です "I'm scheduled to go next year"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Creating a future tense
children.content: Wrong: 行くwill ❌ Right: 行く (with context) ✓ "will go" Wrong: 明日行きました ❌ Right: 明日行きます ✓ "I will go tomorrow"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using wrong form with つもり
children.content: Wrong: 行きますつもりです ❌ Right: 行くつもりです ✓ "I intend to go"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing つもり and 予定
children.content: つもり: Personal intention (can change) 予定: Scheduled plan (more fixed) Not interchangeable in all contexts

children.heading: 〜ことにする (Decide to)
children.content: 日本に行くことにした "I decided to go to Japan" 勉強することにします "I'll decide to study"

children.heading: 〜ようと思う (Thinking of doing)
children.content: 明日行こうと思う "I'm thinking of going tomorrow" 勉強しようと思っています "I'm thinking of studying"

children.heading: 〜たい (Want to)
children.content:
Can express future desire:

日本に行きたい "I want to go to Japan" 寿司を食べたいです "I want to eat sushi"

children.heading: きっと (Surely)
children.content: きっと成功する "I will surely succeed" きっと来るでしょう "They will surely come"

children.heading: 必ず (Without fail)
children.content: 必ず行きます "I will definitely go" 必ず連絡する "I will contact you without fail"

children.heading: すぐ (Right away/Soon)
children.content: すぐ行きます "I'll go right away" すぐ始まる "It will start soon"

children.heading: もうすぐ (Soon/Before long)
children.content: もうすぐ着く "I'll arrive soon" もうすぐ春だ "It will be spring soon"

children.heading: かもしれない (Might)
children.content: 明日雨が降るかもしれない "It might rain tomorrow" 行くかもしれません "I might go"

children.heading: たぶん (Probably)
children.content: たぶん来る "I'll probably come" たぶん大丈夫でしょう "It will probably be okay"

children.heading: 〜ていただけますか (Could you)
children.content: 明日来ていただけますか？ "Could you come tomorrow?" 手伝っていただけますか？ "Could you help me?"

children.heading: Simple Future (Present + Time)
children.content: 明日学校に行く "I will go to school tomorrow" 来週テストがあります "There will be a test next week" 今晩映画を見る "I will watch a movie tonight"

children.heading: Intention (つもり)
children.content: 大学で勉強するつもりです "I intend to study at university" 来年日本に行くつもりだ "I plan to go to Japan next year" 明日早く起きるつもりです "I intend to wake up early tomorrow"

children.heading: Schedule (予定)
children.content: 3時に会う予定です "I'm scheduled to meet at 3 o'clock" 来月引っ越す予定だ "I'm scheduled to move next month" 来週東京に行く予定です "I'm scheduled to go to Tokyo next week"

children.heading: Probability (でしょう/だろう)
children.content: 明日は晴れるでしょう "It will probably be sunny tomorrow" 彼は来るだろう "He will probably come" 大丈夫でしょう "It will probably be okay"

children.heading: Expectation (はず)
children.content: 彼は知っているはずだ "He should know" 間に合うはずです "We should make it in time" 明日は晴れるはずだ "It should be sunny tomorrow"

children.heading: Volitional (〜よう)
children.content: 頑張ろう "Let's do our best / I'll do my best" 明日行こうと思う "I'm thinking of going tomorrow" 勉強しようと思っています "I'm thinking of studying"
